==Events==
* [[362]] &ndash; [[Athanasius]] returns to [[Alexandria]].
*[[1245]] &ndash; [[Bishop Thomas|Thomas]], the first known [[Bishop of Finland]], is granted resignation after confessing to [[torture]] and [[forgery]].
*[[1440]] &ndash; The [[Prussian Confederation]] is formed.
*[[1543]] &ndash; [[Battle of Wayna Daga]] &ndash; A combined army of [[Ethiopia]]n and [[Portugal|Portuguese]] troops defeats a [[Muslim]] army led by [[Ahmed Gragn]].
*[[1613]] &ndash; [[Michael I of Russia|Mikhail I]] is unanimously elected [[Tsar]] by a [[Zemsky Sobor|national assembly]], beginning the [[Romanov]] [[dynasty]] of [[Imperial Russia]].
*[[1804]] &ndash; The first self-propelling [[steam locomotive]] makes its outing at the [[Penydarren Ironworks|Pen-y-Darren Ironworks]] in [[Wales]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; Without a previous declaration of war, Russian troops cross the border to Sweden at Abborfors in eastern Finland, thus beginning the [[Finnish war]], in which Sweden will lose the eastern half of the country (i.e. Finland) to Russia.
*[[1828]] &ndash; Initial issue of the [[Cherokee Phoenix]] is the first periodical to use the [[Cherokee syllabary]] invented by [[Sequoyah]].
*[[1842]] &ndash; John Greenough is granted the first [[United States|U.S.]] patent for the [[sewing machine]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Karl Marx]] and [[Friedrich Engels]] publish ''[[The Communist Manifesto]]''.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Battle of Valverde]] is fought near [[Fort Craig]] in [[New Mexico Territory]].
*[[1874]] &ndash; The ''[[Oakland Tribune|Oakland Daily Tribune]]'' publishes its first edition.
*[[1878]] &ndash; The first [[telephone book]] is issued in [[New Haven, Connecticut]].
*[[1885]] &ndash; The newly completed [[Washington Monument]] is dedicated.
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Ioannina]] is incorporated into the [[Greek state]] after the [[Balkan Wars]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: In [[France]], the [[Battle of Verdun]] begins.
*[[1918]] &ndash; The last [[Carolina Parakeet]] dies in captivity at the [[Cincinnati Zoo]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; German socialist [[Kurt Eisner]] is [[assassination|assassinated]]. His death results in the establishment of the [[Bavarian Soviet Republic]] and parliament and government fleeing [[Munich]], [[Germany]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; [[Constituent Assembly of Georgia|Constituent Assembly]] of the [[Democratic Republic of Georgia]] adopts the country's first constitution.
*  1921   &ndash; [[Rezā Shāh]] takes control of Tehran during a [[Iranian events of 1921|successful coup]]
*[[1925]] &ndash; ''[[The New Yorker]]'' publishes its first issue.
*  1937   &ndash; The [[League of Nations]] bans foreign national "[[Unlawful combatant|volunteers]]" in the [[Spanish Civil War]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Japan]]ese [[Kamikaze]] planes sink the escort carrier {{USS|Bismarck Sea|CVE-95|6}} and damage the {{USS|Saratoga|CV-3|6}}.
*[[1947]] &ndash; In [[New York City]], [[Edwin Land]] demonstrates the first "[[instant camera]]", the [[Polaroid Land Camera]], to a meeting of the [[Optical Society of America]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[NASCAR]] is incorporated.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The [[Government of the United Kingdom|British government]], under [[Winston Churchill]], abolishes [[Identity document|identity cards]] in the [[United Kingdom|UK]] to "set the people free".
*  1952   &ndash; The [[Bengali Language Movement]] protests occur at the [[University of Dhaka]] in [[East Pakistan]] (now [[Bangladesh]]).
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[peace symbol]], commissioned by [[Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament]] in protest against the [[Atomic Weapons Research Establishment]], is designed and completed by [[Gerald Holtom]].
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Malcolm X]] is assassinated at the [[Audubon Ballroom]] in New York City by members of the [[Nation of Islam]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Swissair Flight 330]]: A mid-air bomb explosion and subsequent crash kills 38 passengers and nine crew members near [[Zürich]], [[Switzerland]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Convention on Psychotropic Substances]] is signed at [[Vienna]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Richard Nixon]] visits the [[People's Republic of China]] to normalize [[Sino-American relations]].
*  1972   &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] unmanned [[Spacecraft|spaceship]] [[Luna 20]] lands on the [[Moon]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; Over the [[Sinai Desert]], [[Israel]]i [[fighter aircraft]] shoot down [[Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 114]] jet killing 108.
*[[1974]] &ndash; The last Israeli soldiers leave the west bank of the [[Suez Canal]] pursuant to a truce with [[Egypt]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Watergate scandal]]: Former [[United States Attorney General]] [[John N. Mitchell]] and former [[White House]] aides [[H. R. Haldeman]] and [[John Ehrlichman]] are sentenced to prison.
*[[1986]] &ndash; ''[[The Legend of Zelda (video game)|The Legend of Zelda]]'', the first game of [[The Legend of Zelda]] series, was released in Japan on the [[Famicom Disk System]].
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Steve Fossett]] lands in [[Leader, Saskatchewan]], [[Canada]] becoming the first person to make a solo flight across the [[Pacific Ocean]] in a [[balloon]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[2013 Hyderabad blasts|Two bomb blasts]] in [[Hyderabad, India]], kill at least 17 people and injure more than 100 others.
